newsitem.title: TURKEY: Amnesty urges Turkey to accept Iran, Iraq refugees.
newsitem.headline: Amnesty urges Turkey to accept Iran, Iraq refugees.

text.p: Human rights group Amnesty International on Wednesday urged Turkey to drop limitations on the number of refugees it accepts which effectively bar asylum seekers from neighbouring Iran and Iraq.

"Turkey is one of the only three states all over the world that still imposes geographical limitations," Ozlem Sariguzel, the head of Amnesty's Turkish branch, told reporters at the launch of a campaign.
Turkey only welcomes refugees from eastern Europe under a Cold War waiver, known as geographical limitations, to international rules on asylum.

But most asylum seekers in Turkey in recent years have fled Iran and Iraq, citing political repression. Turkish authorities either deport the would-be refugees or allow them to stay only in transit to third countries.
"We have focused more on the legislative grounds of the refugee problem in Turkey, as this is where the problem stems from," Sariguzel said.
